job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Boise, ID

job_title: Network Administrator in Anacortes, WA
pros: Everyone is super friendly, from Environmental Services to Nurses and Doctors to Directors and C-level executives.  People seem to really believe in the Island Hospital Promise and do their best to make it a reality.  Over the last year or so, the Information Systems Department has gone through some dramatic restructuring, and the results have been outstanding, due in large part to the current Systems Engineer and Network Engineer.  The IS Director trusts his staff to do their jobs and gives them the freedom to prioritize their schedules and projects as they see fit.  At the same time, his door is always open for questions or feedback.
cons: IT pay scales are a bit low, but that probably has more to do with the rural location.  IT staff are salaried, so no OT is available.

job_title: Medical Records Clerk Tech in Burlington, WA
pros: I cannot thank Island Hospital enough for the opportunities they have provided me.  Working here for the past 21 years has been incredibly instrumental in my personal growth, and i will never forget the colleges and friends i have made there.  I have loved my job and i will look back on my time there with wonderful memories.
cons: Document everything !!!  This will be detrimental for you keeping your job.

review_title: I have worked at Island Hospital over 10 years.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Anacortes, WA
pros: Able to deliver excellent patient care. We have some great doctors. This is the best hospital that I have ever worked in. Overall, people are very friendly. Able to trade days off when needed.
cons: Wish that the "worker bees" had more input into decisions and building projects. They are currently remodeling the facility to make it more user friendly. The computer software needs to be changed, but it is cost prohibitive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Anacortes, WA
pros: Co-workers are great.  Management is very nice and will to train new grads. Patient centered care. Decent benefits plan. Emloyor matches retirement plan.
cons: Pay is lower than other hospitals in the area.  It's a small hospital so there isn't a large opportunity for growth as a Registered Nurse.  Only have 8 hours shifts in the Acute Care department

job_title: in Anacortes, WA
pros:
Easy going yet professional.  A happy place to work. Free coffee.
Staff cares about patients and each other. Enjoyable atmosphere.
cons: Hospital pays completely for employees health benefit but spouse an family coverage is cost prohibitive. Good to look elsewhere for family coverage.

job_title: Scheduling Coordinator in Anacortes, WA
pros: Caring employees, good management, nice facility, friendly community, beautiful setting
cons: Not a lot of flexibility with job growth.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Anacortes, WA
pros: Nice facility, friendly co workers, great location.
cons: Management is terrible. They only care about the numbers, they make promises they can't keep. They will lie and throw you under the bus

review_title: Island Hospital Great Place, Great Place to work.

review_title: My experience was unfair, the work environment was hostile and there was no 'joy' in my job.
